messages.title: A Strong Voice for Durham
messages.content: Roberta has been a strong voice for Durham in Parliament. I have taken action to make housing more affordable, for more jobs and investment, and to protect Durham’s environment. I have been deeply moved by the support I have received from across the community and I ask again for your support on 8 June.

keyPolicies.policyDescription: Continue to fight against NHS privatisation, and to secure a properly funded future for our NHS and Social Care services.

keyPolicies.policyTitle: Bring jobs and opportunities to Durham
keyPolicies.policyDescription: More good quality jobs and better apprenticeship opportunities, and support people and adults to access training.
Focus more renewable energy development, safe alternatives for our children, keeping Durham's streets free from litter.
Action to improve air quality for all our children, protect our Green Belt, ensure all new homes are energy efficient, and ensure our university receives funding for excellent research.

issues.economy: Roberta works hard to bring jobs to Durham. She was successful in getting a new Passport Office in the city, retaining the Land Registry, and developing new employment opportunities at Hitachi.
issues.environment: Roberta has worked with partners to deliver better community facilities such as the upgraded Wharton Park; improve environmental protection; support vital neighbourhood policing and enhance our beautiful and historic city and villages.
issues.health: Roberta has been effective in getting new affordable housing in Durham, and an extension to our hospital A&E Department. She is also pressing the Government for more funding for our nurseries, schools, colleges and university.

housing.content: Roberta has been effective in getting new affordable housing in Durham.

leaflet.personalStatement: I have been a strong voice for Durham in Parliament. I have taken action to make housing more affordable, for more jobs and investment, and to protect Durham’s environment. I have been deeply moved by the support I have received from across the community and I ask again for your support on 8 June.

politicalExperience.achievements: Strong voice for what Durham needs, record of delivering for our community. Helped over 50,000 issues for individuals and a number of group projects.

contactInformation.address: The Miners' Hall, Redhills, Flass Street, Durham, DH1 4BD
